intro: Alcantarea trepida, commonly known as the mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at higher elevations. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens. Alcantarea trepida is also noted for its ability to thrive in dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
